intro: Erigeron falcatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small white to pale yellow flowers. Erigeron falcatus is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
